intro: Codonocrinum agavoides, commonly known as the Agave-like Codonocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are typically blue-gray in color. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences bearing small, white to yellow flowers. It is adapted to arid environments and has a slow growth rate, making it a striking addition to xeriscapes. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
